title: Synthetic Recap
body:
By The Associated Press

TORONTO – It was a night that defied belief, a performance carved into the annals of history not by a team, but by one man. In a 117-105 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers, the Toronto Raptors did not merely win a basketball game; they provided the stage for a supernova named Tracy McGrady.

On this night in 1997, the young phenom erupted for a staggering 45 points, a career-high that announced his arrival to the league with the force of a thunderclap. The 76ers had no answer. McGrady was a whirlwind of athleticism and grace, slicing through the defense for explosive drives and elevating for jumpers that seemed to defy gravity. Each basket was a statement, each swish through the net a punctuation mark on a masterpiece in the making.

While Allen Iverson fought valiantly for Philadelphia, pouring in 28 points of his own, his effort was merely a subplot in the Tracy McGrady Show. The Raptors’ star didn't just score; he dominated, supplementing his historic point total with 7 rebounds and 6 assists, a complete and utterly devastating line.

The final buzzer sounded on a 117-105 Raptors win, but the score felt secondary. The true story was the number 45, shining brightly next to McGrady’s name on the stat sheet. This was more than a win; it was the birth of a legend, a harbinger of the offensive explosions that would come to define one of the most gifted scorers the game has ever seen. In Toronto, they didn't just witness a victory; they witnessed history.
